course.subject: IEDA
course.name: Introduction to Financial Engineering
course.description: For DA students. This course is intended to provide an introduction to important aspects of financial engineering. Specifically, this course will primarily cover fundamentals of the financial system, interest rate and term structure, various financial markets, financial derivatives, option pricing and hedging, risk management, and financial modeling.
course.prerequisites: CIVL 2160 OR ELEC 2600 OR IEDA 2510 (prior to 2018-19) OR (IEDA 2520 AND IEDA 2540) OR ISOM 2500 OR MATH 2411 OR MATH 2421 OR MATH 2431
course.exclusions: FINA 3203, FINA 4303

reviews.author: wait whale
reviews.comment_content:
Course Schedule
The schedule is tentative and subject to change
• Week 1: Introduction
• Week 2: Financial Markets, institutions, and instruments
• Week 3 to 4: Fixed Income Securities: theory of interest, bond price and term structure
• Week 5 to 6: Mean-variance analysis
• Week 7 to 8: Capital asset pricing model, factor model, and arbitrage pricing theory
• Week 9: Risk aversion, expected utility, and portfolio decisions
• Week 10 to 11: Basic derivative theory and risk management
• Week 12 to 13: Basic FinTech theory: AI in finance, robo-advising, cryptocurrencies and blockchain, green finance, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: very good teaching. Mr.Jiang taught many complex math skills. He will not only talk about the conclusion, but also teach a lot how to prove it and use the conclusion.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mr.Jiang said he will 30% A range
30%-40% B range
Excellent granding.
Tentative: Homework (30%), midterm exam (30%), final (40%).

I got 97/100 midterm(Mean: 75.04 Median: 82 High: 99 Upper Quartile: 91.5)
hw1:100/100
hw2:96/100
hw3:100/100
hw4:100/100
hw5:94/100
I don't konw my final grade, and the final has 10 mark bonus. I guess my mark is nearly full.

Got A+ finally
reviews.comment_workload: there will be 5 homework. The questions are very close to the tutorial questions. If you want to get a good grade. go to every tutorial and finish the homework very seriously. I'm sure the exam questions is more than 95% similar to the homework and tutorial questions.

reviews.author: jacko
reviews.comment_content: Basically an intro to derivatives, the content is all pulled from John C. Hull's book Options, Futures, and Other Derivatives. This course roughly follows the first 8 or so chapters of the book and then chapter 15 for the Black-Scholes-Merton model (some of the other chapters are probably referenced as well). This course mostly focuses on introducing the notion of derivatives and financial markets so there may be some math but it's mostly quite basic.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Cai speaks quite clearly and he's very happy to answer any questions. Some people might find the teaching to be boring but I quite liked it. If you don't like attending lectures, you can just read the book and you'll be fine.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is good. Score above mean and you can probably get an A.
reviews.comment_workload: Light workload, there were only 3 short homework assignments which consisted of easy questions pulled from the book. The midterm and final were quite similar. If you can do questions from the book and have some decent understanding of the content then it should be a cakewalk.

reviews.author: Aarya
reviews.comment_content:
The content seemed very applicable to real life situations. Topics included:
1. Financial Derivatives
2. Futures Markets and Hedging
3. Forwards and Futures Pricing
4. Swaps
5. Binomial Model for Option Pricing
6. Interest Rates
7. BSM Model for Option Pricing
8. Financial Crisis of 2007-2009
reviews.comment_teaching: He had notes that contain pretty much everything you need to do well in this course. He pretty much reads off his notes and explained the methods to answer the sample questions.
reviews.comment_grading: It is a relatively easy course so everyone gets good grades. Try to do well in the homework segment because the mean is usually high. I missed one homework assignment and got 1 SD above mean in both exams; got a B+
reviews.comment_workload: A few homeworks and two exams, easily manageable. Double-sided  A4 size Cheat Sheet allowed in both exams.x
